page.title: 19CAPT. OWEN, HELICOPTER PILOT
page.content: The Owen's came to Goxhill 2 years ago when Humberside Airport, Kirmington, began to be used as a helicopter base flying equipment and men to gas rigs. These are 17 miles off the North Humberside coast. Capt. Owen flies his British Airways helicopter out to the rigs at 1000 ft. and back at 2000 ft. He learned to fly fixed wing aircraft before changing to helicopters. His job has taken him around the world and he often has special charter work, e.g. taking business men on business trips; taking oil tycoons and friends to the Grand Prix and similar events. Last year he flew the Prime Ministers of the Western Nations when a summit meeting was held in London. Capt. Owen is trained in air sea rescue and wears a survival suit when over water in winter. He flies Father Christmas to Christmas Parties each year.
